Articles.Content: Okay with all the upgrades and updates sense KSP was first released. What do you think the final build of the game will look like? Do you think we will see more NASA backed add ons, maybe othe private companies will want packs to like SpaceX. I think the start of NASA's involvement with KSP has only just begun.

Keep in mind that the New big Single engine (KR-2L) that looks like enlarged Mainsail is better in Atmosphere (ISP 380 Asl) than in Vacuum (ISP 280 Vac) which makes them great for radial mounted Boosters but pretty bad for upper Stages

Keep in mind that the New big Single engine (KR-2L) that looks like enlarged Mainsail is better in Atmosphere (ISP 380 Asl) than in Vacuum (ISP 280 Vac) which makes them great for radial mounted Boosters but pretty bad for upper Stages
It looks like that's a bug with the new engine-it'll be corrected the other way around before the big release:wink:

Keep in mind that the New big Single engine (KR-2L) that looks like enlarged Mainsail is better in Atmosphere (ISP 380 Asl) than in Vacuum (ISP 280 Vac) which makes them great for radial mounted Boosters but pretty bad for upper Stages

Felipe confirmerd exactly the reverse, so maybe is a .cfg compilation fail

Okay with all the upgrades and updates sense KSP was first released. What do you think the final build of the game will look like? Do you think we will see more NASA backed add ons, maybe othe private companies will want packs to like SpaceX. I think the start of NASA's involvement with KSP has only just begun.

Starting to get the point we need to improve the VAB UI again. Separate those engines / fuel tanks a bit with sub tabs. So many parts . I except to see more cooperation with NASA, and potentially other space agencies to add select things to the game. For example, a massive "telescope" part that allows you to spot asteroids in SOI's beyond Kerbin. (except the sun, obviously), and of course the long waited 2nd gas giant ;p

Felipe confirmerd exactly the reverse, so maybe is a .cfg compilation fail

Oh really? But in HOC-Gamings Video you can read the Description on the Engine to be a perfect Lifting-Motor

Go to 3:50

Oh really? But in HOC-Gamings Video you can read the Description on the Engine to be a perfect Lifting-Motor

Go to 3:50

http://youtu.be/fcOb5USqu0A?t=3m50s

Yes i know, but the Harv interview was filmed after the overview of HOC, so it should be just an error of description
You mean Scott Manleys interview at GDC? Havent seen that one yet but it is No. 1 on my Schedule

I think that we are approaching what the final build will look like. I reckon that aerodynamics, re entry heat and space plane parts will be re done first though. I'm also hoping that the game will continue to get updated after its official release.

You mean Scott Manleys interview at GDC? Havent seen that one yet but it is No. 1 on my Schedule

Yes that one but i can't remeber the exact moment

Yes that one but i can't remeber the exact moment

Dont worry Daze, I will watch the entire thing

Improved performance, though still a bit limited by unity.

The main focuses of the game will be single-player career mode and multiplayer sandbox. Single-player sandbox will be thought of as somewhat secondary. Parts will be balanced mainly with career in mind; it's possible performance figures might differ between career and sandbox, at least until you fully "upgrade" everything in career.

No mining or resource exploration, as they would make it feel too much like Civilization IN SPACE.

More and better tutorials and scenarios.

A redo of most models and textures, to give a more unified art style.

A much more developed Kerbin, that actually feels somewhat like a populated planet rather than just a space centre on an empty world.

SNIP

A much more developed Kerbin, that actually feels somewhat like a populated planet rather than just a space centre on an empty world.

But I like the Space Center on an Empty World, Then I don't have to worry about dropping my command pod in Someones back yard. (Or a booster on their head)

Keep in mind that the New big Single engine (KR-2L) that looks like enlarged Mainsail is better in Atmosphere (ISP 380 Asl) than in Vacuum (ISP 280 Vac) which makes them great for radial mounted Boosters but pretty bad for upper Stages

From the stream the other night. Looks like a normal Isp curve to me.

I think that the final build will be filled with bloatware and laggy.

Unity just is not made for these kind of things.

http://i26.photobucket.com/albums/c128/raptor_87/KSP/KR-2LYargnit_zps05c9af93.png

From the stream the other night. Looks like a normal Isp curve to me.

That vacuum Isp is actually really good, considering its power level.

That vacuum Isp is actually really good, considering its power level.

Finally i can make interplanetary stage without LV-N which seems similar to Constellation program..

Starting to get the point we need to improve the VAB UI again. Separate those engines / fuel tanks a bit with sub tabs. So many parts .
And then you add some mods and you have massive 8-10 page list to find that one engine that you need. Perhaps a possibility to filter with size filter and/or fuel type filter (i.e. Only 3.5 meter SRBs). Perhaps even dropdown menu for mod (Squad, Kethane, KW Rocketry and so on)?

I think that the final build will be filled with bloatware and laggy.

Unity just is not made for these kind of things.

people simply never read why the devs chose unity and whenever there is a performance issue they blame it on unity not being cryengine.

-snip-

No mining or resource exploration, as they would make it feel too much like Civilization IN SPACE.

You don't seem to get the point that resource mining was never cancelled, what was shelved (again not cancelled) was the original format they initially tried it in...

Ok, well, the final release will probably have many realism improvements (aerodynamics specifically) and we will have more places to visit, additional things to do on other planets, probably some non-career mode things too.

AI s, though in pretty minor forms, probably like airtraffic.

More effects, additional functions in the VAB/SPH.

More rover and airplane things aswell as base things....

since its less than a 1/4 complete, we don't really have a big clue as to what might happen...

That vacuum Isp is actually really good, considering its power level.
The J-2 clone is a better Mainsail, really. Though from what I can tell, the RS-25 clones are more impressive in Isp if not TWR. (The booster version, however, is silly.)

I wonder if they'll be tweaked.

since its less than a 1/4 complete

Um, you're not basing that on the version number, are you?

I think that the final build will be filled with bloatware and laggy.

Unity just is not made for these kind of things.

A valid concern, but given that each patch seems to mysteriously manage to improve the framerate, I doubt it.

Um, you're not basing that on the version number, are you?

do YOU, think they are going to skip version numbers ? and even then do YOU think they will stop updating after that ?

not me....

do YOU, think they are going to skip version numbers ? and even then do YOU think they will stop updating after that ?

not me....

I don't think they will use all the numbers between 0.24 and 0.99 before 1.0 arrives. At least, I really hope not, we wouldn't see 1.0 this decade.

do YOU, think they are going to skip version numbers ?
Software developers often do, for any number of reasons.
